byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and JULIE BOSMAN

abstract: Progressive groups both in Chicago and nationally are hoping to use competitive runoff election in Chicago between Mayor Rahm Emanuel and Jesus G Garcia to highlight Democratic Party establishment's ties to wealthy donors and business; fact that Emanuel has record of accomplishment on many liberal priorities illustrates expectations of a resurgent political left.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Rahm Emanuel, a former chief of staff to President Obama, faces a surprisingly competitive runoff against Jesus G. Garcia, who is supported by progressives frustrated with business-backed politics.

headline.main: Chicago Mayor’s Race Is Cast as a Test of Liberalism
headline.print_headline: Chicago Race Is Cast as Test of Liberalism

snippet: Mayor Rahm Emanuel, a former chief of staff to President Obama, faces a surprisingly competitive runoff against Jesus G. Garcia, who is supported by progressives frustrated with business-backed politics.
